content: app needs updating but seems to work correctly.

Used this on most versions of Android including 10 (many phones, ROM's, custom and stock for the last five years with no issues. Just upgraded to the paid one to show some love to the dev. As I use it all the time. Some new effects would be nice if possible.
Good app but where are the updates :( it's not broken on Android 10
Good

Love this app and it pairs really well with my Pi and LED setup. Awesome effects and very easy to control. I would love if there were more effects or maybe a way to program your own (user friendly way) and also maybe scheduled feature so that you can have it change colours as the day goes on (smooth transition from light orange, to light blue, to red and then dark blue)
From this app to the pc version or even the full documented website. Every part is amazingly well done. Btw I'd love a fireplace effect!

Need some documentation on how to configure.  It seems very straight forward but for some reason it won't connect to my rPi3. I can get my lights to work via the Java app, but can't connect via the mobile app.
Hyperion is ace. App works well. Thanks hyperion!
Great app works like a charm after configuring. Would like an option for black border detection for movies though.
Big thumbs up.
Must make tutorial for settings and setup!!!!!
If I could add some effects this would be great.  There is no effects folder on my phone or on the Raspberry pi.  Where can I locate,  download and install the necessary effects folder?
This is the best and easiest method for setting up Hyperion for your taste regadrless of lighting solution.
It would be great if there was an alarm/sunrise feature. Great app!!
Needs tasker
Free version is great,  we are here supporting the developers. Keep up the good work.
My one suggestion; Tasker integration/plugin. That would just add some awesome sauce!
An Android wear version for the paid app would be great.
App works perfectly. Using a raspberry pi and a ws2812b LED strip.
Works perfect!  Made my setup even more awesome.   Paid version to support dev.
Still 5 stars, but and android wear app would be great! ;-)

this works quite well, I had to change the .json file to get the effects listed  It should be /storage/hyperion/effects instead of /opt/hyperion/effects.  so edit the hyperion.config.json in /configfiles/ so that the effects path is for the folder on openelec
Works brilliantly
Excellent app for the hyperion light system.  Only thing that could make it better would be widgets.
The color wheel works fine but there are NO effects listed under the EFFECTS menu nor any thing under COLOR TRANSFORMS! I tried downloading the free version too just to try and its all the same.
replyContent: The Hyperion config has a path to the effect folder. Is this path set correctly? The transform issue may be a problem with your config. If you want to solve this please send me your config and some more information about your setup.

content: Love this... Ambilight on a Raspberry Pi with this is just amazing... 100 ws2801 LEDs are just beautiful.
What more do you need? Well OK maybe the ability to save config changes to Hyperion.config.json
How to get effects working?
replyContent: The Hyperion config has a path to the effect folder. Is this path set correctly? Please contact me if you can't get it to work.

content: Got the free version and was impressed with the ease of connectivity. I then bought the paid version for the effects, but the effects tab in the app is blank! Poop. After moving the effects folder on my PC all is now right! Thanks devs for the help.
replyContent: Both the free and paid version should have the same set of effects. Does your Hyperion config have the path to the effects folder correctly set? When the path is wrong, no effects will show up.

content: Absolutely love this and Hyperion in general. Is there any way to have a color schedule that sets the color or effect depending on a time rule.. Eg fades through a sun rise in morning, set colours throughout the day and then calming colours at night before auto off... Then repeat each day?
Works great, but would like to see the ability to save multiple presets for settings. That way I could easily switch them for different types of films like animation.
Worked perfect. Would like to see ability to do sound reactive like the boblight droid app does, though.
Great app
Just upgraded from boblight. Love the detailed documentation on GitHub!
Works great even this early on, can't wait to see how far this app progresses!
